text: hello I am Bennett I answer any other
playoff related book from the rubble of
Aleppo to the red carpet in Ankara bana
a labid and her family are now being
hosted by the Turkish government which
opposes the Syrian regime when we met
this child of war told me how her own
home was flattened by a bomb I'm
planning to go out and suddenly it
landed so we got scared and ran to the
basement when our house was bombed he
goes out with the rabble safely but we
were about to die because the house was
collapsing from inside Aleppo her
message echoed around the world with
help from her mother who manages her
Twitter account but some have questioned
whose views were being shared when your
mum was tweeting was she tweeting your
words or tweeting her words me and mom
together yes
her mother Fatima insists the Twitter
account was banners idea but admits it
is a way to combat the regime I think
then I was a big fighter there
I think our twitter was a weak one your
twitter was a weapon yes but the tweets
attracted threats and made it harder for
the family to join the mass evacuation
of eastern Aleppo Fatima got banner onto
one of the bosses disguised as a boy
today even the fighters are openly
leaving their former stronghold but bad
weather is slowing the last of the
departures
just days after leaving banner is
already missing her old home I was happy
to leave but sad at the same time I wish
I could go back to go back home I live
in my house because I love it even if it
had bombed
I loved my house we wish and all work on
a summer day before saying goodbye
banner sang us a song about childhood
and stolen freedoms I am one voice
raised for countless others who often go
unheard orna Guerin BBC News Ankara
[Music]
